item.title: Command-Query Separation
item.description: No, I'm not going to talk about CQRS, but the ideas behind both concepts are similar. The Command-Query Separation principle was first introduced by Bertrand Meyer in his book Object-Oriented Software Construction. Mr Meyer states as follows: Functions should no produce abstract side effects. Meyer differentiates two kind of functions when we design a class: Commands: those functions which produce abstract side effects (change the observable state of the object).
